Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but rooms are (I know it's Paris but...) SMALL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luke242
Reviews.Content: I thought staff was generally good, however there were some minor issues. Cigarettes on balcony never cleaned at non-smoking hotel and the room smelled like cigarette so we were asked to move rooms which happened the next day, which was nice of them. We were also told because of the trouble we would get "free breakfast" which was already included in the price we paid, then told would get free bottle of champagne (not for me because I don't drink much) but never got it. I never made a fuss of it, because I did not see a use and did not want to bother over such things. Not important,but just mentioning. If you go to this hotel I recommend taking Roissybus from Airport, about 10 min walk from where it drops you off. Room is VERY SMALL. Smallest I have ever been in,even compared to Japan, picture is abit deceptive and like previous reviewer mentioned to try asking for certain rooms numbers does not make a big difference, I had 3rd floor (room 315) and "1st", 3rd was bit bigger (nicer) but barely at all, again picture is deceptive. I now learned it is "13 square meters / 140 square feet" from what I now know, if you care about that. I knew it would be small but was a bit shocked. Also door would not properly close/lock on 3rd floor bathroom in the room,but this is not a big deal I guess. Location cannot be beat, very good. Breakfast was alright, nice pasteries. I would consider staying at hotel ampere next time as rooms are bit bigger, but location is not as central at all. Also, not that this is their fault BUT the room was very hot as it was unusually warm in March in the room (thanks to global warming?), and when called to ask how to turn on air conditioning, was told that there is none in March, this was not the best, and wish we could control it ourselves and found it uncomfortable to sleep at times even after putting the room to coldest it could go to for "winter settings". To sum it up, nicely decorated rooms but VERY SMALL and service could be a bit better and I wish you can use air conditioning if room is hot, window only helped a bit and noise outside not fun for night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: princessNDJ
Reviews.Content: Pretty close to the Louvre and within resonable walking distance to other attractions. Hotel was clean and staff were pleasant however the rooms were very small. There was no tea or coffee making facilities which I think is a must when there is no restraunt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Staff, and an Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: FSU1999
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris alone for two nights. I chose this hotel based on its location and other good reviews on Tripadvisor. I have to say, this hotel should be in the top 100 hotels in Paris. The staff was extremely helpful and spoke perfect English. The location could not get much better as you can walk to many of the major attractions in Paris (Louvre Museum, Opera, Notre Dame, etc..). A metro stop is just a 1 minute walk away. If I go back to Paris I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel with a friendly staff and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Rami Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Opera Garnier and the Louvre. The staff is friendly and cooperative. Breakfast is served daily. It exemplifies the Best Western model--reasonable price, comfort and and cleanliness. My room, #105 was small but one of the managers told me to ask for rooms: 207, 314 or 315, if I wanted to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: tmnorway
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a stay at the hotel. I stayed in the top suite with two friends. The hotels location was great, walking distance to the Louvre and close to the Pyramides metro stop, only two stops from Lafayette. The room was spacious and very clean. We had a flat screen TV and a iPod-dock with speakers. The room was like a loft and was the only room on the top floor. Couldn't hear any noise, which is rare with such a central location. We arrived at 11 am, but left our luggage there as check-in wasn't before 14pm. They also provide storage of bags after checkout, which was nice since our train didn't leave before 20pm. The receptionist was very helpful booking us a table at a lovely local restaurant, and the staff was overall extremely friendly. The negatives: I found the room a bit cold, but it shouldn't be a problem during normal temperatures (extreme cold periode in Europe now). The bathrooms lack of separate heating was a bigger problem, 18-19 celcius degrees is too cold for my taste. Also, the wireless internet didn't reach up too the top floor, even though we were told it should. All in all I would definitely stay here again and recommend others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honest O
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in January and it was absolutely fantastic. Having read the reviews I was not apprehensive about staying at the hotel as I knew what to expect and yet when I got there I was still overwhelmed at how fantastic it was. The hotel itself was lovely, good location but what made the hotel exceptional was the staff! I really havent stayed in a hotel like it for a while. The staff were friendly, effiecent and very courteous. We only saw three members of staff during our stay, a nice young lady, a young gentleman and an older man. All three members of staff where so helpful in offering directions, advice on the local area and where to eat even offering to assist in helping with tours. The hotel itself is a hidden gem, it is only small but very very clean, modern and central. It is near Pyramids metro station and just down the road from the Louvre (Opera metro - main line) so is a great place to stay with great links to all major attractions. Advice would be to buy your metro tickets in the airport Zone 1-5 (total for 3 days 44 EUR per person) using the metro is easy once you know all the lines and is the cheapest way as all the attractions are spread out. Go from the airport to Pyramids station, walk towards Barclays bank, when you get to Barclays turn right and then the first street on your left (after the push bike rack) is the hotel. - if you dont know where you are going and you get the metro it can be difficult to find. If you want a nice Itallian go to Trivolli or PastaPapa, both near the hottel.. Fab! If i was to return to Paris I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_SG
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent! 3 minutes from Pyramides metro station, 5 min from the Lourve museum, 15 min to Rue Cambon, where Chanel Flagship store is located. It is in a small alley, so it can be rather quiet at night. Room wise, it is consider big for a Paris hotel. We can walk comfortably in the room. Plus point: there is a iPod docking station for my iPhone! We enjoyed our own music in the quietness of the room. The Philips flat screen TV is big. The toilet is very clean and new. The whole set up is rather cozy. Minus point: Lift is miserably small. Just nice for 2 adults with 2 luggages. The wardrobe is also tiny. Service wise is great! The gentleman who checked us in was helpful and even gave us a room at 7am when we arrived. We were terribly jet lagged and need sleep. He manage to give us a room with 2 beds. The next day after we return, the bed was "converted" to a double bed even without us requesting. That's very thoughtful. Breakfast is at 12 euro per pax, so we decided to venture further to find other breakfast. The restaurant beside Monoprix, Royal Opera, serves excellent value for money breakfast. We would consider staying here the next time we visit Central Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Seyran07
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Paris and it possible to walk everywhere; then you can discover more than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an over-night stay - great location, makes you feel like you are 'en Paris'”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location in a quiet street less than 2 minutes walk from Pyramides Metro (where there is also a great Bistro on the same junction). Given the location, lack of a restaurant is no issue. Rooms are 'typical for Europe' in this price bracket meaning they are small by some standards but are perfectly serviceable. Having found this hotel, it is now my 'base of operation' when in Paris. For site-seeing, the Louvre and Place de la Concorde are within very easy walking distance. The reception staff are very helpful and speak fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Paris sights”
Reviews.Author: Tiredandhungry4444
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris a few times before and always stayed at high end, high priced hotels. This trip was a romantic break with some sightseeing and we did not want to spend a fortune. Having been there before I knew that the Louvre area is the best place to stay as you are close to most of the attractions you want to see - walking distance in fact. The hoteliers also seem to know this as prices are very high. We found the Best Western Paris Louvre Opera on line and booked blind having read good reviews. They all seemed to be true. An outline of the stay: The hotel is nice, clean and well appointed. Rooms are small but all hotel rooms and elevators are small in Paris, even the really expensive ones in my experience. In this hotel each room has a flat screen TV, safe and a nice modern bathroom. Be aware that with period buildings with classical proportions the rooms get smaller as you get higher. We were initially booked into a room on the 4th floor, it was small and had a rather musty smell in the bathroom. I knew from the reviews that the hotel are keen to please so we didn't freak out and make a fuss but asked politely if we could move and we were, to a much bigger room on the first floor with windows that opened out on the street. It was lovely. Didn't have the breakfast as read it costs 11 euros and instead opted for Starbucks/Eiffel Tower breakfast which was fine. The reception staff were friendly, courteous and helpful (although they don't know everything so be prepared to figure out your own restaurant choices). All in all had a very good stay, in what is a great priced, comfortable, clean modern hotel in a great area. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: fredsoda
Reviews.Content: I definitly recommend this hotel by the localisation at first but aswell for the quality of service. You are 10 mn by walk from opera and louvre. A lot of restaurant right at the corner where you can enjoy some of best asian food. I definitly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: LD6422
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Paris Louvre Opera for a week in October, 2011. I am a middle aged grandmother, travelling alone, so had some specific requirements when looking for a place to stay. I do have to say that this hotel met all my requirements fabulously. The hotel is easy to find and on a quiet, yet well lit side street. My room actually faced the street, and though there was some street noise during the night (cars starting, etc.) it was surprisingly minimal. Being October, it got light late and dark early -- I never once felt uncomfortable walking around the area in the dark. Transportation around Paris is very easy from there. There is a metro stop literally around the corner with easy, line 7 connections to all the major sights and monuments. If you prefer to walk, the Louvre is about a 10 minute walk, the Orsay 10 minutes and Les Halles area is roughly 15 on foot. For department store shoppers, Galleries LaFayette is only 2 metro stops north, and The Forum at Les Halles is roughly 4 stops the other direction. For the serious (window) shopper the high society stores are 3 blocks to Rue Honore and go right about a mile down (where you can see actually steel toe shoes with 4 inch spike heels!) In the area are all the ammenities you will need -- a grocery store, the Tourist Bureau (museum passes and maps), a laundrymat, bakeries, wine and chocolate shops, cafes, several banks (ATM) -- even Starbucks! The hotel does offer breakfast but I didn't partake because of the options in the area. The room was typical Parisian cozy -- great for just me, but honestly, I would feel really cramped if I was travelling with someone I didn't didn't know well or didn't like very much. The bed was comfortable and the bathrom had a tub / shower combination and lots of counter space. The staff kept things very clean, very friendly and were extremely pleasant and helpful. The BW Paris Louvre Opera is a great budget option in a very central location. I will gladly stay here again when I am able to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit-Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: whitney353
Reviews.Content: Pros...Wonderfully located hotel! We were just a few blocks from the Opera, the Louvre, and the Vendome. Many cafes, restaurants (especially Asian cuisine), and metro stops nearby. The breakfast (complimentary to us via a discount at booking) was very much an added benefit. As for the service, our room was made everyday and Claire (front desk associate) was extremely helpful, friendly, and understanding of our English/French language barrier. We definitely recommend this hotel, and we would stay here again in the future. Cons...At 182.00 Euro per night, the cost was expensive considering the size of the room. However, this is not really a con. My husband and I are just not used to the cost of living being so high and the spaces being so small. Again, this is a total "tourist" complaint. We loved the hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - female staff was the worst”
Reviews.Author: minnego6
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris we had some concerns on how we would be treated. Upon checking in, the gentlemen at the front desk was friendly and helpful. Told us how to get to train station and where we could purchase tickets. However, our room as well as the bathroom was so small. We had a tiny wardrobe closet that hardly could accommodate clothes for one, plus no where to put your luggage. Also our room was above the hotel entrance which had some street noise at times. When the female staff was working, we felt like we were on our own and shouldn't bother asking them any questions. The hotel area was off the Ave de Opera and is half way between the Louvre and the Opera House, so it was an easy walk either direction. Train station was only one block from he hotel and taxis were cheaper than what we expected. This hotel was priced above average, but the location was the only good thing I can say it. The one saving grace for our stay was the limo service they arranged to the airport, if it wasn't for a knowledgable driver who call ahead to check our flight, we could have been dropped off at the wrong terminal and missed our flight home. Next trip to Paris I would find any other hotel but this one. There was no value for the money. Also forget any hotel breakfast included at this price, croissants for 12 euros was beyond my budget. But there are nearby outdoor cafes that have fresh pastries and coffee. Also you have at least 6 other hotels in a few block radius that I am sure have better rooms and services for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DB2499
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent and the staff went out of there way to make our stay special. We did not speak French very well but the staff accommodated us and even translated. This was a huge help to us during our stay. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, quiet and compact!”
Reviews.Author: Holidayseeker2
Reviews.Content: Only 7 minutes walk from the Louvre, the hotel is very central in a quiet set of streets, known as the "Japanese Quarter" (I think) - bascially a couple of streets with very popular Japanese restaurants and noodle bars. It's extremely near the Opera, and an ideal location for fabulous (window) shopping on Rue de la Paix. The hotel looks recently refurbished. The rooms are very compact, but perfect for a city trip where it's just a base to sleep. The rooms are clean and quiet with about 5 or 6 per floor. We didn't opt for breakfast as we prefer going out for it - it was EURO 12 per person. The lady on reception was very helpful, as was the chap who was there in the evening/overnight. There is no wireless in the bedrooms, only in the lobby. Great value for money. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gskumt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days in July 2011. The hotel is quietly located in a side street from the bigger Av. De Opera, where you find lots of restaurants and shopping oppositions. Our room was big, even for Paris standard, the cleaning was spotless. The flat screen tv is properly the biggest, I ever seen in a hotel room. Breakfast was fine, taking the size of the hotel in consideration, and the breakfast-staff did all they could to make you fell welcome. Reception-staff was primarily younger, 25-30 and helpful. Free WiFi worked fine, and the location is hard to beat. I’ll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Compact with style”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Best Western traveler
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are very small the space available is well used and done in an elegant style. It is all a bit dark but we slept well and I was able to run several international Skype conferences from the room with the free Internet. The breakfast was fine and the location is very convient for getting around Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Sandybeach099
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located in Paris. There are many tourist sites in close walking distance. There is also a metro station around the corner along with a small grocery store (which was under construction while we were there). The hotel is on a side road which is very quiet. It is small, with one clerk at the desk. All of the staff members are very friendly and helpful. They all spoke several languages. When planning excursions or needing directions, the staff was more than helpful. They seem to really enjoy their guest and were eager to converse with us daily. We would go back in a minute without exploring any other options.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Xenolith
Reviews.Content: Pleasant and helpful staff. Hotel in a superb location for the Louvre (only 10 minute walk). Very clean and tidy. Rooms very small, but then you are in the centre. If I had a criticism it would be that the beds were too hard. Would be happy to come back, and happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great value for money hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: HenryRecon
Reviews.Content: It's my second stay in this hotel and the experience has been as good as the first one. The best possible location in the centre of Paris. The room was great, comfortable and well designed. The service is very good, beyond what you would expect in a three-star hotel, the management and the team are very helpful, and always happy to provide with help, relevant information and good recommendations. The place where I will stay next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL, CHARMING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Dem6806
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and handy hotel in the 1st arrondisement. Helpful ,caring staff; GOOD RECOMMENDATIONS for local restaurants;

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen from hotel room safe. Wedding Anniversary Ruined”
Reviews.Author: tripelx
Reviews.Content: This was our first wedding anniversary and we chose to do it in the most romantic city, Paris. The hotel its self was what we expected from a central Paris location, small but comfortable. One the morning our our checkout I opened the room safe, started removing our travel documents, passports, camera and money, everything was there apart for the money, the amount of 300 euro was gone. We searched the entire room without joy, I then went to the the front desk to inform them of what had happened, being surprised that someone could get into the safe undetected I informed the lady at the front desk that I had forgotten the code and if she could retrieve the combination to gain access, she responded by saying it was not impossible and they would have to call someone. I then admitted this was not the case and I wanted to know if this was possible as money had been stolen from the safe, to my amazement she changed her story to say the safe was totally secure and not accessible to anyone. She claimed to have misunderstood what I was asking. The result of all this was being left with no cash and as our credit and debit cards where also in the safe and possible compromised we had to cancel these immediately. Leaving us in a foreign country with no currency. We have been emailing the hotel manager for the past 4 months who initially said this was a insurance matter, he has now responded by saying the insurer needs proof the money was in the safe for the claim to be made, which of course is impossible for us to provide. Throughout the past 4 months the manager at the hotel has acted in the most unprofessional and inconsiderate manner. This entire experience left us feeling helpless and cheated, it was to be a celebration or our fist wedding anniversary, sadly it was everything but. This is one review you can not afford to ignore.

Reviews.Title: “We're coming back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catsinthebelfry
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small! But we had read the reviews beforehand and knew what to expect so it wasn't too much of a shock for us when we arrived. Some people in our group paid a little more and got a slightly larger room (facing the street). The tinier rooms seemed to face the courtyard and were very quiet. -What I simply don't understand is people who book a hotel and don't do their research before arriving. So it was upsetting to see a person have a fit because his room was too small. He aggressively asked the receptionist for a larger room. Why didn't this guest read the hotel's reviews before booking?- Everyone in our group was delighted with our week-long stay at this hotel. The rooms were clean and recently renovated. The bathrooms were modern and tastefully appointed. We found the housekeeping and breakfast staff very nice. Most receptionists were also friendly and helpful, especially Thierry. I found the small breakfast buffet perfect. French pastries, bread, madeleines, biscottes, jam, butter, honey, Nutella, crêpes, scrambled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit, hot drinks, juices, apple sauce, cereal, milk, etc, There was everything I needed. I heard some Americans complain because there were no made-to-order eggs and bacon or pancakes. Well: This is France! Try a French breakfast!!! :-) There is someone cleaning and serving the hot drinks, but the premises aren't really equipped to have someone cooking hot breakfasts as well. We all slept super well and found the mattresses very comfortable. Even the people whose rooms faced the front (the street) said it was quiet at night. Our favorite part was the hotel's location! You can walk everywhere from here! Walk one minute, and you are on Avenue de l"Opéra. Walk 5-10 minutes one way and you reach the Opera. Walk 5-10 minutes the other way, and you are at the Louvre. This location can't be beat! Walk 10 minutes in another direction, and you will be on place du Marché St Honoré, where you will find quite a few restaurants. On Ave de l'Opéra, very close to the hotel, you will find a supermarket and department store (Monoprix), a pâtisserie (chez Paul), a Starbucks, and many boutiques. There are few restaurants on that street. However, the smaller streets surrounding the hotel are teeming with Japanese restaurants (all price ranges). Wireless internet is free and available in the reception/breakfast area, so smartphone and I-Pad users congregate there. You can get free internet in our room too, with a cable hooked up to your computer. The receptionist will provide you with the cable. We liked this hotel so much that we are already planning to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect boutique hotel in the heart of Paris - beautifully appointed, comfortable and modern.”
Reviews.Author: Kaye06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days in early May, and cannot speak too highly of the quality of the accommodation and the efficiency and friendliness of the staff. Our bedroom was just lovely, very comfortable and spacious, and bathroom facilities were excellent. I could not think of a more perfect location to explore Paris - very close to the Louvre, Opera, and the Metro. We found a lovely restaurant just around the corner, and had the most wonderful couple of days in Paris. Will definitely rebook here when we come to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the location.”
Reviews.Author: pinkvalise
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great staff and is clean. It is smaller than the other hotel we have stayed in while in Paris, but I think it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly central, clean, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Cest0vatelka
Reviews.Content: I ran the Paris Marathon on April 10 and spent seven nights at this hotel. I didn't know that it was a Best Western, but that wouldn't have influenced my decision at all. Best Westerns in Europe are usually in a higher category than those in the U.S., so that would have worked for this hotel. Anyway, the best thing about this hotel is its location and quiet ambiente, tucked away as it is in a tiny side street just off the Boulevard d'Opera. Both the Louvre and the Opera are a short walk away. Tuilleries Gardens are closeby. You can walk to the Musee d'Orsay and even to Notre Dame, if you like to walk. Wow! The room for two was TINY, so was the bed. The latter may have been smaller than full size! You couldn't open a suitcase on the sides of the bed. Only one person was able to use the shelves and storage in the room. But we made it work. Our windows were facing the center courtyard, so it was really quiet at night. I had free Internet access, which was great as I had to finish off a job I had to complete by a deadline. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. I asked for a printout of a page and it was brought to my room after I had scanned and e-mailed the page to the hotel staff. The area is rife with Japanese fare, but understand that like everything in Paris, even the small restaurants and holes in a wall are EXPENSIVE. This has to do with the formerly mighty dollar which is worth next to nothing these days. Just go abroad and you will see.

Reviews.Title: “Great family/friend stay at cozy Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: dglov1
Reviews.Content: Group of 15 came to Paris to sightsee and run the Paris marathon. All stayed at this hotel and enjoyed quality time with friends and family. Hotel was very accomodating, very clean rooms, and in an excellent location with great access to train station. Would definitely stay here again. Continental breakfast each morning was also very tasty and fresh...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: marlboroArl
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris with my son. Hotel was very conveniently located. We spent five nights at this hotel. We took a bus from the airport right to Opera which was near the hotel. The other sights were also easy to get to from this hotel as metros were very close. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel manager was very attentive to our needs and made us feel at home. Hotel was immaculately clean. The breakfasts were amazing. At breakfast we met the nicest people that we spoke to . They also had the nicest experiences at this hotel. If I return to Paris which I hope to with my husband I would stay at this hotel again as I have very fond memories of my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small, nice hotel close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: LarsDane
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights in February attending the Pharmapack exhibition. The hotel was chosen , as it was close to several metro stations, close to many attractions and close to the major shopping areas (mights as well combine pleasure and work whenever possible). The hotel is like many other, older Paris hotels. The rooms are small, and the rooms are not intended for two people with large suitcases or as a place to unwind before burning the midnight oil in front of the laptop. The rooms are exactly what they are ment for - a place to crash when exhausted by sightseeing and worn down by walking the streets of Paris. The room was clean, well functioning and with a good quality bed - I slept like a log all nights there. The bathroom was also clean and functional - but excessive space is not a word in the vocabulary here. Every square meter is used. Breakfast is not included - if time is not a problem try some of the good café's in the area - but for a quick bite before work, it's fine. WiFi is free, but beware that the WiFi turns to WireFi in most of the rooms - WiFi works best in the lobby. So bring your own cable or borrow one in the reception - then it works perfectly - provided you get the username and password in the reception - these changes on a regular basis. The staff is very attentive and helpful and apologised that the interned connection went down 1 am one night - it was up and running the following morning so my mails could be sent. There is a safe - this does not accommodate a laptop - but since i didn't bother to log it along to an exhibition and conference I left it there - no problem at all. The location is quiet - and the narrow street does not encourage heavy traffic - and definitely not any parking! All in all it was a fine hotel, taken price and location into consideration - and I can recommended for both business and leisure. But if coming from abroad - be aware that the rooms are not US standard size - then you'll not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in the City of Light”
Reviews.Author: FPortugal
Reviews.Content: Like said in previous reviews, the hotel location is one of its strong points. Very close to the metro (just across the street) it's easy to get to every part of the city without having to walk long distances. Louvre is also very near from the hotel. The staff is unbelievably friendly and helpful too (for portuguese travelers: Cristina speaks Portuguese). They really know how to welcome their guests. If something was needed i would not hesitate to ask for it. As for the rooms, it is true that they are small but have enough space for a couple and are well equipped (tv, air conditioner, hair dryer, hot water machine). Cleanliness is also a key point at this hotel. In addition to this, rooms were very confortable (what else can you wish for when coming back to your room at the end of the day?). When booking this hotel be sure to have the breakfast included rate, best way to start the day (see photos). To sum up: would definitely go back and would recommend this hotel to every traveler who wants a good stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JeffK_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a great location. 2 minutes walk to the metro, 5 minutes to the Louvre. The continental breakfast was fantastic. We were up early one day to take the train to London for a day trip, and we saw the fresh baked pastries being brought in. The coffee was also amazing. The staff were incredibly nice and helpful. Terry was always making us feel right at home. The rooms are small by north american standards, but they were very funcional. We had 3 suitcases (we packed too much) and we had room for all of them. Internet was also great, and they even printed our train boarding passes and london attraction tickets for us. We felt totally safe even at night walking back to the hotel. If you are looking for good food nearby try Fuxia. It is an italian restaurant, that had amazing food, and was recommended by some locals for us. All in all, when I go back to Paris, I will be staying at this hotel, and I doubt I will even shop around. I thoroughly enjoyed every second of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, tiny room for 2, pricey breakfast, use the safe!”
Reviews.Author: familyphysician
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the metro and 1 stop from Louvre and Madeleine for Rue du Faubourg St Honore so location is great and gets a 5/5 for location. However the room size was so tiny for 2 people sharing with hardly any space for luggage (choice of front of building double room but this room has no double glazing and there is a gap between the windows so not a complete seal for sound-proofing noise from the street or the back room with no view which is even smaller). I saw both and opted for the back room for quietness. The cleanliness I rated a 3 as I saw a pubic hair on the bathroom floor, was repulsed and immediately thought of the tv show Hotel Inspector and the carpet smelled. There was one tiny guest soap for each guest so had to use the same soap to wash my face and for my bath. Other amenities include bath gel and shampoo bottles. The breakfast was pricey. I was told 12 euros for continental breakfast upon arrival. Suggest go to Starbucks on Avenue de l'Opera just round the corner. Sleep quality I rated a 2 as the thermostat ranged from 16 to 18 yet at night the room was sweltering hot. One night we opened the window all night but then it became freezing cold so I woke early freezing. The next night we opened the window to cool the room and then closed and repeated this. So no win situation. As for the free wifi, it was only accessible in the lobby and not in the rooms, so I was given a user number and password for access and would trek down to the lobby with my laptop to access the internet. The hotel does not provide any computers so bring your laptop. We got a special price from Best Western for early booking, else in my opinion it would not be worth the regular nightly rate of 200 euros. There is a small safe in the room but not big enough for a laptop. I would suggest you carry your valuables everywhere as I did and do not leave at this hotel. The receptionist also strongly recommended we use the hotel room safe. My friend and I both agreed we would not come back to this hotel again and could not recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect small boutique hotel in a beautiful 17th century in the heart of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Recon1969
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, less than 10 mn walk from the Louvre, the Opera, Palais Royal, the Grands Magasins, Faubourg Saint Honore, etc.. Lots of tube stations around. Very quiet small street, very Parisian, with beautiful old buildings....and not much traffic. Very well renovated building from the 17th Century. The staff is as professional as helpful and friendly. Hotel and rooms are very clean and tidy. Thank you to Christine, at the reception, and to Olivier, the hotel manager, for their advises on restautants, musuem and exhibitions and wise recommendations! Very good! Ask for room 209 with its very nice volume, high ceiling....and very quiet, even if on the street side.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: Dem6806
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, boutique hotel located in the heart of the Opera area. Olivier the manager, is both delightful and so helpful. This is our 2nd stay there, would go back again! Clean, and great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, a bit bare.”
Reviews.Author: Book Goddess
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in small rooms that are well done, with storage hidden away, etc. These rooms are tiny and not so well appointed. But that said, ours was clean, the bathroom looked recently upgraded, and the staff was helpful. We walked everywhere, and ate well. This was an affordable place to lay our heads. Oh, and the bed was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Paulo_Jr
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. You can walk to the Louvre, the Madeleine, Opera Garnier and the Gallery Lafayette. The hotel is small, apparently newly renovated because everything seemed new.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: MaiteQatar
Reviews.Content: I wanted to repeat my nice experience in this hotel. I was here in april 2009 and I thought it was ok and well located. I made my reservation as usual, trough the Best Western web site and booking the highest rate because of it´s flexibility. I did it and and the next week I needed to change the reservation because we changed our plans and we have decided to stay just 3 nights in Paris, SURPRISE, they bolck 277 euros in my credit card!!! No warning was given to me...and I have to insist I had booked the flexible rate!!!! I wrote to the hotel and they ignored me, so I wrote to Best Western and the hotel answered me: "it was an standard procedure to verify my credit card" excuse me??? do you need to block for 7 days my credit card with 277 euros in order to check if it's ok??? and why they did it when I change my reservation and no when I made it???? Too weird and I am not satisfied with the explanation. I have stayed twice in Paris with Best Western hotels, this one and the Premier Saint Michel and they didn't do the "standard procedure" before, so people BE CAREFUL! I am also a frequent traveller and this is the very first time in 20 years that something like this hapen to me.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: balmoral03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in August. Rooms were small, but clean, modern and elegantly furnished. Free Wifi in lobby. Location felt safe and was convenient, close to Pyramides Metro and the Louvre. Japanese bakery, Aki (which made French bread) is one street away and is a great place for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and eager to help!”
Reviews.Author: Guinn's
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the Best Western Paris Louvre Opera with a 5-month-old. The hotel was extremely accommodating to special needs that we had, such as needing to use the microwave frequently, and needing lots of extra towels for all the baths the little guy needed! We never once felt like we were inconveniencing them. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and was helpful when we had questions about Paris attractions and stores. The hotel was clean, modern, and well-kept. It was smoke-free and it has a great location. It is walking distance to the Louvre and Pyramides subway stop. My only complaint was - the windows stink. They are extremely old. As a result, they let in noise, drafts, and cigarette smoke odors from the street below (even when they are completely closed). If you keep the curtains closed, you can keep most of the noise, odors, and drafts out. However, that does mean that your room will continually be dark! This didn't bother us much. We were only in the room to sleep anyways! However, if you plan on spending a lot of your day in the room, especially in the winter, it could be a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Close to where you want to be, or right near the Metro to get you there”
Reviews.Author: SummerBreakisGreat
Reviews.Content: Nice, but small, rooms. Super hot water. Ask for room away from the street, noisy on the weekends. Breakfast is basic compared to US cont. breakfast, but great coffee and fresh bread. Right near 2 Metro stops, 5 minutes by foot from the Louvre. Staff spoke limited English, but went out of the way to help- with printing and internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lynnky
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this property was great. Oliver at the front desk is the best. He is very helpful and friendly. He helped us so much we couldn't wait till he was back on duty each day. The rooms were small but very quiet . The hotel is very clean. Everyone was kind and all front desk personell spoke English. We were out sightseeing all day so the room size didn't bother us. The location was convenient to everything. We would stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, no frills but nice and it's in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jaymeeone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in July, 2010. The staff is nice enough, it's close to a Metro station and you can walk to most tourist attractions. The rooms are pretty small, but I guess that's Paris. As far as cost, I found this hotel to be a great deal compared to the others in the neighborhood. If you are looking for a decent place to stay that is safe, clean and in a great location, you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: friendlytigger
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in good location. 5 Minute walk to the Louvre. Close to alot of restaurants. The room was nice and clean, quite large for what i was expecting. The service was ok. Breakfast was offered in the hotel but i felt was quite expensive so we ate elsewhere, whic in turn had more variety as well

Reviews.Title: “At walking distance from Louvre and Opera”
Reviews.Author: schoella
Reviews.Content: Main advantage of this hotel is its location close to the metro station and a lot of paris highlights. The room ar not big but clean. Although it is close to a big street it is not too loud at night. Breakfast is good. A good value if you get it at a good price

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a side street just off the Avenue de l'Opera, so a great location as it is easy walking distance to the Louvre and Opera. Lots of shopping around here too, and a number of very good Japanese restaurants. Staff are friendly but the major downside is the size of the rooms. Small hotel rooms are to be expected in Paris - however this was quite literally 3 metres by 3 metres. Travelling for business this is manageable. However any couples looking for a romantic break would need to pack light as there wouldn't be room for two suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Room, Great Staff, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Speedoboy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in April 2010. The staff were very friendly, the room was clean, spacious and a great size. I even had a bathtub in my room. The staff even brought up a kettle, with tea and coffee. It had a little bar fridge and good clothes hanging space. The hotel was in a fantastic location, walking distance from most of the major sites of Paris - the metro was at the end of the street as well. I want to go back to Paris - just to stay at this hotel again! The only downside was that I could only stay 2 nights at this hotel - as it was booked out -- I had to move and stay elsewhere for the remainder of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin21
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in very nice area. The Hotel is quite small and getting a seat at breakfast can be a bit of an issue but everything else is perfect. The staff are very helpful and have no hesitation in offering advice. The hotel is very well kept and seemed to be recently refurbished. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “great location , sparkling clean ,comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: breingan
Reviews.Content: stayed for 6 nights with 12 y/o grandson.. our room was on the front right over the lobby on the 1st floor ..I loved watching the street and construction..might not be for everyone ..can be noisy ..I think the neighborhood bar was next door ..on friday night the sidewalk crowd got larger and louder ..I swear they were singing OH MY DARLING CLEMENTINE IN French ..when you closed the windows and curtains it was quiet enough ..we were right around the corner from the Lourve ..within walking distances to most everything and trust me I am not overly ambitious..plenty to eat in area , breakfast was my only complaint ..was included with my room rate but could only get hot food if I went to breakfast room ..couldnt even bring it back to room yourself ..only the contiental ..which really didnt make much sense...but overall was very happy..wifi was free and worked great .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rucip
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location - close to metro, Louvre, Opera, Grands Magasins, etc. The rooms were however very small (almost jumped directly in the bed...) and there was some nasty smell in our bathroom on the top floor. However, the room was very clean. Another problem was breakfast - maybe it is a generalized problem with parisian hotels: it was not included in the room price and was incredibly expensive (12 Euro per person if I remember well) for what appeared to be "pas grande chose" - luckily so many nice cafes are just around the corner! Maybe we would go back for the position, but we might as well try another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Thierry”
Reviews.Author: jkfchan
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Paris. We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. I must say Thierry and his staff are wonderful. They will be there at all time solving every problem we encountered. Let me just say thank you. I am sure Thierry is reading their review at this website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service”
Reviews.Author: CherylcSydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. Clean and modern. Rooms were very small the only draw back. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, friendly and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: rainbow1Uk
Reviews.Content: We were made very welcome from the start - with an upgrade to the large room beneath the eaves being very welcome. A small but friendly hotel with staff who went out of their way to be helpful - even managing to get us a taxi to the Gare du Nord when there didn't appear to be any free in Paris! An inviting breakfast with an extensive range of pastries, along with meats, cheeses, yoghurts etc, and good coffee. Spotlessly clean room with good storage, and towels, shampoos etc replenished every day. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tamerin
Reviews.Content: It was an awesome location - 10 minute walk to the Louvre, in the 1st arrondissement. The only problem was how VERY hard to find it was! The male staff were very friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent elegant boutique hotel in the heart of Paris with the most friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: keanos
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at our Parisian Hotel we were treated with the most excellent hospitality and friendliness. Thierry at concierge, with his amazing sense of humour and wonderful personality was able to help us with some difficult situations that arose during the course of our stay. He definitely made our stay all the more enjoyable. The room was modern, elegant, and clean and being a boutique hotel had a warm friendly atmosphere that is sometimes missing in the larger establishments. We will definitely revisit this hotel on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value - TOP LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Katiek14
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the end of November - FANTASTIC location. 10 minutes walk to the Louvre, 5 minutes to Opera. Metro station about 2 mins walk, and close enough to about another 5 metro stations to make use of the different lines. Room was compact (4th floor) but they are in Paris. Quiet side street (bit noisy in the morning, but no more than you'd expect in the centre of a city). Only negative was the ceiling height in the bathroom - my boyfriend is 6ft6 and couldn't fit under the shower - but this is common for him. All in: FANTASTIC location for exploring Paris. Staff - brilliant, super helpful Price - got it for a steal with Expedia Will definitely stay next time

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: inspirion
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, walking distance to most sites,very nice rooms, easy to get to from the airport. use the train from the airport. would stay there again. staff very friendly. breakfast not cheap, but plenty of places to eat within walking distances of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Preh
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Spoke english. Breakfast was good. Location was great. Modern bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - GOOD PRICE - GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: akerbrie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my holidays this Sept. The location is perfect, near everything, near metro pyramides, near Louvre, near Cityrama Travel Agency, with a supermarket across the street (monoprix). We have the opera avenue one block from the hotel, full of good cafés and shops. The rooms are very modern, with all the necessary facilities you need (including internet). They are clean, just a little bit small. The breadfast is very good. What is the most important thing,however, about this hotel is its staff. Everyone is extremely helpful, nice, they really care about their guests. They try to solve all the doubts and problems you may encounter. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: buzzsolo1
Reviews.Content: My self and 2 sons aged 15 & 18 went for a short break to paris flew by easyjet from Luton to CDG airport which was all very nice on arrival got roissy bus to the opera if you arrive at T2 you need to come out of airport and turn left keep walking until you see the sign for the bus which cost all 3 of us about 30euros when arriving at the opera which is the last and only stop walk down the avenue de'la opera keeping to the left until you come to starbucks on the corner turn left there and then take 2nd right very small quiet narrow street hotel is at the end on the left - on arrival greeted well, small reception area with a few seats and this is also where you have breakfast in the morning we were in the only ground floor room No 100 which as i had asked had 3 single beds not a lot of room but we only slept in it bathroom was very nice good shower and quite spacious. Hotel and room were always spotless breakfast was very good with 1 hot option and being off the main street hotel was very quite at night . From here all attractions are within walking distance but we got the 2 day hop on hop off bus passes (for all 3 60euros well worth it) as you get to see and hear a lot of things about Paris. The Diana memorial still stands and many things now written about Michael Jackson alongside her. Eiffell tower was very busy so didnt que for this but did buy tickets on internet for the Montparnasse 56 tower it has the fastest lift in europe the views were spectacular we went at night as we had been up the Arc de triomphe in the day time also well worth a visit they only charged me 9 euros boys went free. To eat out in Paris is very expensive make sure you know the price before ordering anything or you could be in for a shock a pint of lager is about 12 euros yes over £10 we went to pizza hut 1 night bill was 70 euros and had a meal in a french bar/cafe 2nd night for around 60 euros so shop around go of the main drag for the better deals and if you can get set menu deals these can also be good. The weather was very kind to us and although i dont think i will return to Paris (This was my 2nd visit) my boys said they would like to return 1 day perhaps with their wives who knows!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: CanuckGirl08
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, just a few blocks away from the Louvre. There are some fantastic cafes near by. La Taverne de L'are Sec (I think) with red awnings at 88 Rue Staint-Honore was the most amazing dinner. Their mixed meat and cheese tray with french bread and red wine was the highlight of the trip!!!!! Beautiful location and with the right shoes you can walk to all the sights in Paris. Small rooms - didn't provide shampoo/conditioner - but its 3* so you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent house with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: RamonMallorca
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 5 days in july and we are 100% agree with all the comments. This hotel is a wonderful option for visiting Paris, staying at a central location, with a small pretty modern hotel and attended by LOVELY staff. A VERY BIG AND CONGRATULATIONS to Isabel at the reception. Kind, attent, happy, she make everyone fell very warm welcome. But also the rest of colleagues were very kind. For all the spanish clients Isabel speaks very good spanish. Muito ubrigado Isabel, gràcies

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Tinka7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Best Western Opera for 4 nights during our one month Europe trip. The staff was VERY friendly. Amazing staff. They gave us maps and information on how to buy tickets on the subway, etc. I have to admit the room was wayyyy better than I expected since everybody I know has said every hotel in paris is tiny as hell and not as pretty as Asian hotels. The only downturn in our experience in the hotel, was one day they didn't makeup our room. It wasn't that bad but still they forgot to. They did apologize and was very nice. If anybody is taking the Eurostar to Paris like we did, remember to bring Euro change/coins because when we first arrived in Gare du Nord train station we could not buy a damn subway ticket because we only had notes. We could not find the machine that accepts notes so we were wandering around like idiots. 2 guys approached us asking if they could help us but honestly I think we looked like easy people to steal from or like take advantage from... so we finally just took a cab. It was not very expensive, very close! Took 15 minutes by cab! Worth it! =] I loved Paris. Its so romantic and such a pretty city with so much architecture, etc. The hotel was very clean and very comfortable. They did only have a few channels which was music channel and news!! The hotel was in a very convenient location, do make sure you have a map, its very easy to get lost, since I got lost twice! Try and recognize which shops are next to your intersection of the street so you won't get lost!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for getting around Paris, very clean, and wonderfully helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jaimeparistoujours
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009 and was very pleased. Couldn't be better for the price. Clean, two minutes from Metro Pyramides, close to Tuileries. Monoprix and other stores within a block. The best part was the staff - they were very helpful. Got a lot of advice on places not to go and when the best time was to go to others. I had a problem with a medical device while there and they made a lot of phone calls for me and got the replacement part delivered to the hotel. Would stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Parisian Find”
Reviews.Author: Rochester_NYLee
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week stay at the Hotel Louvre Opera and cannot stop talking about it! It is a wonderful, small hotel near the Opera. Its location is perfect for exploring the city! I was able to walk almost everywhere. If not, the Metro was close as were taxis. The breakfast buffet was lovely and the rooms very adequate and clean. The hotel is only one block from a major avenue, but the hotel was very quiet. The staff was cordial and the manager, Olivier, incredibly helpful! If you are a lover of history, you will enjoy knowing that Toulouse-Lautrec once lived here. This is a hotel that I highly recommend and where I would definitely stay on my next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EMMull
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for several nights during our first trip to Paris. We had read previously that the hotel rooms were small in Europe, so at least we were prepared for that. The room was small, but not unmanageable. It was also clean, with a free safe to use, and an updated bath and shower. My only complaint is that all of the television channels were in either French or Japanese (I know, I know, I am in France) - it would have been nice to just have one channel in English. The staff at the front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful for any of our questions (and spoke great English!). The breakfast here did not disappoint at all. Every morning, we had great eggs, salami, cheeses, croissants, yogurts, fruits, and coffee. This was included with our room for ~5 euros and was well worth it. Overall, this was a great little getaway. Very convenient - close to metro station and walking distance to the Louvre. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: NancyN99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Opera is quite simply a "jewel." Some friends and I spent a week there in May and could not have been more pleased. Not only is the location ideal, but the hotel is clean, well-appointed and the staff helpful. The rooms are not large, but certainly adequate by Paris standards. It is located one block from the rue de l'Opera on a very quiet street, One can easily walk almost anywhere. I cannot say enough about Olivier, the hotel manager. One of our party had some health issues and he went out of his way to ensure that she had everything she needed. We felt as though we were staying with family! Now that I have found this hotel, I cannot imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: lektor
Reviews.Content: Very central location, within walking distance of practically all things interesting in Paris. Breakfast ok but scrambled eggs is the only hot selection, and with few tables, one could well be forced to wait a while when one arrives in the morning. Nice service. Quite small rooms with little room for luggage, bathroom also small, but everything fresh and nicely appointed. Good beds, quiet and no noise in the night. Excellent value at the price we paid. Would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for bargain price”
Reviews.Author: ElsieannCanada
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this lovely little hotel near the Louvre. Wonderful location, central but quiet with friendly staff. Breakfast is a bit pricey but we went out to local boulanger. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round hotel for short trips to Paris”
Reviews.Author: jellymousse
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my partner for a birthday surprise trip at beginning of April and was very impressed with this hotel. The location is perfect for Opera, Louvre, Seine and in easy reach of all major attractions, with the Metro line a couple of minutes' walk. Hotel is small, friendly and very clean with a good breakfast offered. The room was smallish but stylishly appointed and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting good, clean, comfortable accommodation in the city for a pleasant city break. I can't think of anything I didn't like about this hotel. It was perfect for us. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MaiteQatar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a vacation in Paris. The hotel is small, like most in Paris but has a great location...and we have never experienced such a very nice service before. We stayed in the 3 persons bedroom because we were travelling with my sister and was a small but pretty room, clear and clean. We recommend this hotel if you want good service...ask for Thierry and you are going to be in good hands!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catpower2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend sightseeing in Paris, and we found it to be the perfect location, with lovely rooms and great staff. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris location”
Reviews.Author: MiamiParistraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently with my family at this very good hotel in Paris. Its location is superb, providing easy access by foot to most central Paris locations. Also, has good restaurants nearby and Metro stations. The hotel staff is very nice, diligent and really helpfull. Talk to them and ask suggestions, they will help you. The hotel was recently renovated with very good bathroom in each room . Good value for families . Simple and direct service. Rooms are a little small when compared to american average hotel rooms (as most hotels in Paris..) , however they have all you need and are super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RedDevilsFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in room ensuite for our family of three. Good value for money. Good room size with a comfortable double bed and a roll away single bed. Large bathroom (by Asian standards). Loved the room interior with modern design. Spotless rooms with bedsheets and towels changed daily. Nice warm heating system in both bedroom and bathroom. Friendly staff (by French standards) and they speak good English. Excellent location as it is central to most attractions - we walked to Louvre(10 mins), Galaries Lafayette(10 mins), and even to Notre Dame (30 mins). The metro station Pyramides is literally just across the street and we use it when we don't feel like walking. Monoprix (with a great supermarket) and Paul (a bakery) is just across the street. My son loved the hotel!! We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: sunglasses-08
Reviews.Content: This is a very reasonable "compromise" if you want to stay in the St. Honore area but don't want to spend 500 Euros or more per night. It is not quite as busy and crazy here as some other more touristy areas, yet this is still walkable and easily rideable to just about everything - only 5 to 10 blocks to Louvre, Orsay, Opera Garnier, Gallerie Lafayette and just about everything else except the Eiffel Tower (although we strolled to that once as well). Metro is one block away, nearby nice cafes, Japanese restaurants, and fine traditional French restaurants on tree lined boulevards. We had trouble with a van shuttle service on arrival at CDG airport, and the RER-B was on strike, so lucky for us that the 9 Euro RoissyBus from the airport stops only a few blocks away up the hill! Located on a small side street, the hotel is quiet and unpretentious, definitely compact yet comfortable. Recently rebuilt and nicely appointed, especially the bathrooms, it was clean and efficiently run. The beds were the most comfortable we have experienced anywhere in Europe. The hotelier himself, a most charming and perceptive young man, was often at the desk and at our service, and the assistants and staff were all about crisp, efficient yet genuinely friendly service. During our week, we often felt like we were staying with friends - it was a polite, pleasant place to be, for starting or ending a day in Paris, and we will definitely try it again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great home base”
Reviews.Author: oldboy_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for nine nights during our first visit to Paris, celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary. Our room, while small, was spotlessly clean, well appointed and comfortable, Staff was friendly and helpful. The location was ideal, many of the Paris ‘sights’ being walkable, a good breakfast patisserie just a few steps away on rue des Petit Champs and for the evening meal a swatch of good eateries at Place du Marche’ St. Honore’ a couple of blocks away. This hotel is an ideal home base for those who will be spending their days out and about exploring the city. Be sure and have a good booklet map and index of Paris streets. The tourist foldup handout doesn’t do it.

Reviews.Title: “Mean and Scary”
Reviews.Author: Kelly W
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the BW.com website. I made a mistake when entering my information and only had registered for one guest (there were 2). So, immediately, I contacted BW at their 1-800 number and told them what I did. They said the hotel was booked and that I couldn't make a change. After about 3 emails and 3 phone calls, I gave up. We had already has a deposit charged on our credit card so we decided to just show up and in the worst case scenario... my husband and I would have to share a very small bed or one of us could sleep on the floor. When we arrived at the hotel, the hotel manager-Christine- met us at the desk. She had been anticipating our arrival and had plenty to say to us. She berated us for causing so much trouble with our reservation. She said that every time we called BW and made email requests, she got in big trouble. She said she had started a file on us and had an inch thick file of her paperwork. I apologized and explained that we couldn't get BW to say it was ok for the change or to give us an answer one way or another but she was hearing none of it. She told us she was very very upset with us and charged us an extra fee for the extra person. I said that was fine and that we were happy to pay for the difference, but again, she didn't care. She gave us a room key (#419) and sent us to our filthy, noisy, tiny room. We could barely walk around the sides of the bed. While I am sorry that is the way the BW does business, I have had othr stays at perfectly fine ones. I am not sure who I am more angry at: BW or her. They both were way out of line. And by the way, don't be fooled by the continental breakfast. It is not included in the price, they will charge you anyway, and it is pretty bad. Tea/coffee and bread. I think there a container of cereal also, Let's put it this way- not worth the 14 euros each that they charged us! Yikes! Never again! The area was horrible and the street smelled like sewer. It was in a bad section of town and several blocks from any transportation. Scary!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: emiana
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in room 520 (the triple room in the attic) with our 16 year old niece (who loved the room). It was a great stay. The room was big enough for the three of us and it was fun being up in the attic. The beds were comfortable and the room was spotless. There was plenty of room for luggage and clothes. The bathroom was nice - bath with shower, good water pressure. The only thing I didn't like was the bathroom sink. I kept hitting my head on the jutting out mirror. Clearly, not a big deal. The hotel is very centrally located and the staff was friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast in the hotel because there are plenty of places nearby and we did not think that Euro 14 was worth it. Also, wifi isn't included and must be paid for separately (which I find extremely annoying). Overall, a great place to stay and I would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great rooms & Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: alison85belfast
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel in july for 5 nights. the hotel staff where very friendly and helpful! :) the rooms are very clean, modern and nicely decorated (Flat screen tv) the bathroom has a shower/bath (running hot water!!! - nothing like a relaxing hot bath after all that siteseeing- great!!) this hotel is worth staying in as its very close to a number of tourist attractions, restuarants, train stations, shops etc. The area the hotel is located in is safe if you would like to go exploring the wonderful sights at night time. I would consider staying at this hotel again as it put "the icing on my cake" for my lovely holiday!! :)

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SophiaMuenchen
Reviews.Content: The best western paris louvre opera is a charming small hotel in the city center of paris with excellent service and friendlyness of the manager and staff members. Small rooms, good quality of the beds, very clean - especially the bathrooms and modern decoration with good taste. Price /vs. quality is excellent. In the area around, there are lots of very lovely restaurants, especially Japanees/Sushi ones but also small inviting Cafes, Bars and Brassseries as well as small boutiques and different shops. It is a good stay for enjoying the main sight seeing bullet points in Paris and for crazy nights going out because everything is quite in walking distance. Mother w/ 4yr old son

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CJG97
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Best Western Louvre Opera - it is a lovely little hotel, very close to the Metro and of course the Louvre! The hotel room was small but spotless and extremely reasonable for the price. The breakfast is very expensive but there are lots of little cafes close to hotel to catch a coffee and choc au pain. My only complaint is that the rooms do not have tea/coffee making facilities and although you can order complimentary coffee, it was quite an effort! The staff were very pleasant and I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel for a long weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MariPap78
Reviews.Content: My name is Maria. I stayed at Best Western Paris Louvre Opera Hotel at the beginniing of November, 2007. I came to Paris with my parents. I may say that this Hotel is a wonderful place to stay. The breakfast are vey tasty, the rooms are cosy and clean. The hotel is situated right in the center, so we had no difficulties of reaching any places. I would like to THANK the team of the Hotel for my great staying with them! Maria (Russia)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shihui
Reviews.Content: The location is great and easy to find. Just 5 mins walk to the Louvre and Metro nearby. Lots of great Japanese restaurants around the area and quiet at night. The rooms are not as small as I thought and is clean. The down side is service. They are ok but will not go the extra mile. I was to make my way to Orly airport on the first day of the transport strike and all they could tell me is that it is a BIG problem. No suggestions nothing. We got to find out on our own that there are still trams which bring us to the orly airport bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: Huboux
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is perfectly situated to all the attractions. The area is safe and walking distance to the Louvre, L'opera, Place de la concorde and much more. This is where you want to be. The rooms are small but clean and new. The bathroom is clean and narrow. The hotel staff is friendly and helpfull. The value to price ratio is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 5fortravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double and triple room for 3 nights. The location was close to many sights but taxis don't always have an easy time finding it. The room was fairly small but clean. The staff seemed indifferent, not nice but not mean either. They would help if it wasn't too much trouble. Overall, was satisfied but wouldn't look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jennifer118097
Reviews.Content: Great location. Near Louvre(5 min.), tuilleries and within walking distance to Mini mart, restaurants and lots of other major attractions. All you need is a good map - we were able to walk leisurely from hotel to Eiffel within an hour. If you have kids I recommend booking the biggest room they have.Definitely small everything in this hotel- also try to get a room with a window to the street. Staff was helpful when asked but they are not so forthcoming..... All in all if on a budget this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh...Paris hotels, don't you just love em...”
Reviews.Author: Dezzydez
Reviews.Content: I always dread booking Paris hotels, after having settled on something dependable for the last couple of years, we had to find another as we were exhibiting in the Tulieres. I knew it was going to be difficult to get something decent without paying ridiculous amounts. Our 1st 3 choices were taken, and Paris Louvre Opera seemed to fit our requirements - clean, recently renovated, near location. Located on a very narrow street off Avenue Opera, disembarking with luggage on a busy day was not easy. Hotel lobby was small but everything was tastefully decorated. 1st room they gave us had the bath as we requested, but it was TINY (smaller than HK hotels) and right outside the elavator, which I specifically requested to be away from. After a quick moan, they changed us to a room at the back. Room was bigger but no bathtub. We took it. My wife is always a good gauge about the comfort level of the room and she slept very badly throughout our stay. Not much natural light, dinghy, bed was not very comfortable. Shower doors were badly sealed so every night there were huge puddles on the floor. Always had to ask before they gave extra towels to mop up the floor. As the hotel did not provide free slippers, it was unpleasant having to walk around with a wet bathroom floor. The worst was the fact the cleaning lady hoovered the sheets instead of changing them, we noticed the sheets appeared clean but had the same water stain for 2.5 days. The management changed the sheets after another complaint. All in all Iwe did not like the hotel and will not be returning. On the positive side the location is brilliant, the price reasonable so try and secure one of the better rooms if you do decide to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We ain't comming back.”
Reviews.Author: pmfigueira
Reviews.Content: Our expirience at this hotel wasn't very pleased (4 night's) First we couldn't sleep the first night at the hotel because the room had "some problems". Dispite having our phone the hotel didn't told us about this problem and so we had to walk 200m with our bags to a nearby hotel. The next day i just had acess to my room at 14:00... About the hotel: The hotel is very central and has a metro station nearby. The room was very small and had a terrible insonorization. It had no exterior window as i had asked. The lobby lacks a computer for internet acess (dispite having wireless). Dispite all this Paris is gordious. Paulo e Rita Figueira (Portugal)
